page.title: 13Farming near Newent
page.content: The soil determines the type of farming in an area and the heavy loam soils to the east support a range of mixed farming while the lighter, sandy soil to the north are mainly arable. The weather for most of 1985 was much wetter than average and the hay crop was delayed and quality was only average. Many of the farms in the area now make silage as well as hay. This has the benefit of good feed-value and the cutting of the grass is not so dependent on long periods of dry weather. The corn harvest was badly affected by the wet, cool summer and was late. Most farms are highly mechanised and agricultural machines and tractors are a common sight. Most livestock is taken to the Monday Market in Gloucester, the main animals are beef cattle, dairy cows and some sheep- prices have been good.
